column4: so how would I put kde on if I allready got the version with gnome?
I'd send you to the wiki page about it, but the wiki is down =)
Even if your card's not natively supported, there's always ndiswrapper
Same as standard, except you'll need to get 32-bit firefox if you want flash, etc.
Honestly, you're much better off with 32 bit...codecs and other proprietary stuff requires it
Like I said, better off with 32 bit
Risky stuff, if you value your data
You can play chick by copying large files over and over again with a friend...
They'd work, at about a 20-30% or more speed loss
It gives you no power as a user, unless you run as root =P
Heh. I used to play MU*s fervently...good stuff
GNOME wins, because I like it better!
